answers.answer: If diabetes runs in your family some one must have a BG meter.  see if they will test your BG 1 hour and 2 hours after dinner.  that is the 2nd best test.  the best test is OGT Test (Oral Glucose Tolerance Test).  to be done correctly they need to test your BG every 20 minutes for 2 or 3 hours.  That test will tell you how well your body (pancreas) handles carbohydrates.  It tests both phase 1 and phase 2 insulin response.
So, basically the bloodwork was for nothing.

Also, I don't have a BG meter. My parents said that the doctors checked if you have diabetes... I don't if I should believe this or not. My parents said that it can also be anxiety. I mean I do 10 push up or more and 30 to 20 sit-up a day

"So, basically the bloodwork was for nothing."for one thing you dont say what blood work you had done or what the result was.  I didnt ask if you had a meter I said,  if diabetes runs in the family then some one must have a meter you can use for a couple of tests.Yes anxiety can give many of the same symptoms,"urinate a lot well sometimes only when i drink two water bottle"  thats normal. diabetics urinate all the dime and have thurst that cant be quenched.
One more thing. I think its just anxiety because I'm shakying right now. But when I breathe into a bag or my hands the shaking stops

Hey it's me again I ate a lot of cake and a bag of doritos, after that I work out but than all of a sudden I gotten this huge headache than I started to pee a lot and it was clear, I also feel ill like I'm about to puke. . . I been panicking a lot.

You may have a disorder that isn't diabetes. When I was a teenager, I was an anxious worrier, but mostly worried about my health (in my case I was afraid of cancer). As an adult, I got panic attacks and found out that I have an anxiety disorder which is treatable with anti-depressants. You saw the wrong kind of doctor. Have your parents take you to a psychologist or go back to the MD and tell him you're having panic attacks and constant anxiety. Tell her how afraid you feel all the time. The shaky and blurry feeling are consistent with panic attacks and anxiety disorder. There is treatment out there and it will get better. Until then, when it hits, stop, take deep breaths and remind yourself that it isn't you, you just need to ride it out and you'll feel better soon. Or have a cup of herb tea and a hot bath. Just remember, your fear isn't rational, it's part of your brain chemistry. And go get help for this.It does get better, I promise.The bloodwork should have included a hemoglobin A1C test which would show whether you had high blood sugars 3 months before the test. If it was normal, you aren't diabetic.

One more thing I been peeing a lot but it comes out clear, I don't drink a lot of water, also my body is faugile I'm always yawning and panicking, I been so scared that I forget to drink water. This moring I had a chocolate muffin than when I was yawning I felt light headed and my eyes felt like it was rolled back, I almost fell to the ground. I was very scared at that moment. Usually my Peeing problem starts at night I'm always worrying about it. And this may sound crazy I even try to smell my own pee and I keep breathing in my own hand to see if it smells fruity. I'm going crazy about this diabetes thing, I need help, badly I'm 15 and  already going nuts. Please... Response to me.
And I'm not getting enough sleep

question: Hey I'm 15 over weight, and I think I have diabetes type 2. I went to the doctor's to check my blood work a few days later they called me and said I have high cholesterol. But I feel like I have diabetes I have dry mouth urinate a lot well sometimes only when i drink two water bottle. I have high Anxiety's. Sometimes I have foggy visions, I'm very scared diabetes does run in my family though.
title: Can someone help me
